question: online resources test omega 3 levels blood test at home
generated_answer:
Document 2: ADDClasses.com provides free expert information, plus an online library of expert talks for a fee

Document 4: I used a simple dry blood-spot test for home sample collection. Leading laboratories analyze the sample to determine your fatty acid profile as a reflection of your diet. It takes less than a minute to complete, and you can access your results online anonymously after about 20 days. The balance test identifies levels of 11 fatty acids in the blood with 98% certainty. You will learn your blood levels of omega-3 and your ratio of omega 6:3 for balance, plus receive a report to increase your health and dietary awareness.

Document 5: Fatty Acids Diagnostics
In a collaboration with the leading independent European lab for fatty acid analysis in the body (erythrocyte values) we offer healthcare professional and users the opportunity to measure individual omega-3 levels and omega-6/3-ratios.
Measure your fatty acid profile through a self-test: All that is needed is a few drops of blood from your fingertip (dry blood spot). The blood result is available after approx. 10-14 days after shipment of blood sample.
Analyse of your individual fatty acid profile with nutritional recommendations through a 5 page test report. The result totals 26 fatty acids and include your omega-3 index, omega-6/3 ratio and trans fat level.

Document 6: Essential fatty acids are, well, absolutely essential! We measure this for people all the time by looking at the level of Omega 3 versus Omega 6 in the bloodstream. Omega 6 fatty acids come from things like grains, bread, wheat and pasta, and rice. Omega 3 fatty acids, which is the good fat, comes from raw seeds and […]
If you have low blood levels of Omega 3, you are at enormous giant risk for high blood pressure, cardiac death and heart health problems. Do you know why? Low Omega 3 levels contribute to tons and tons of unregulated inflammation going unchecked throughout your body.

Document 8: A few weeks ago (as documented in this post) I pricked a finger, dabbed some blood on a blotter card and, feeling rather smug that I’d “upper percentile” the hell out of the results, sent the sample off to have my Omega-3 levels checked via the Holman Omega-3 Test.
Well, the results are in…and they’re rather surprising. Actually, they’re disturbing.
But before we dive into my actual results, let’s look at an explanation of how the test results are reported. This is straight from the email that accompanied the results documentation -
The main indexes of omega 3 health are the value for total omega 3 and the percent of omega 3 in HUFA (highly unsaturated fatty acids). Total omega 3 levels are reported as a percentage. If you have a total omega 3 score of 5% that means that there are 5 omega 3 fatty acids for every 100 fatty acids in your blood. Most Americans have around 4% total omega 3, which is widely considered as deficient. It is my target to have your total omega 3 above 9% (or 9 omega 3 fatty acids out of every 100 fatty acids in your blood).

Document 13: The tests also reported the Omega index which is the total percentage of all five Omega 3’s in our blood. This should ideally be above 9%. Here again I took the honours but only just, at 10.6%.

Document 16: Test at home your Vitamin D3 levels to ensure sufficient levels are maintained. A postal test performed by a UK NHS lab. Buy Online!
SunVit-D3 Vitamin D Test Kit is used for measuring Vitamin D3 levels for use at home. SunVit-D3 have worked with Sandwell and West Birmingham City Hospital NHS Trust since 2016 to distribute its simple and accurate home test kit so that you can assess your own vitamin D levels. The only way to truly know if you are deficient or to regulate your vitamin D intake.

Document 19: We don't yet know the range of acceptable values (as was the case for cholesterol), so there is a compelling need to determine optimal levels for age, sex, or medical condition. Knowing one's personal blood levels are too low would motivate dietary change or supplement use, and repeat testing would measure the patient's progress. Though the test is not covered by most insurance, individuals can get their numbers at boutique labs for $100 to $200.

Document 20: Could you please tell me what “natural omega product” you used that has helped your psoriasis? Thank you!!!

Based on the provided documents, there
ground_truth_answer: Zone Labs offers an easy, at-home blood test to check levels of Omega 3s in your system, which can be found at zonediagnostics.com.

5. **Claim about receiving a report to increase health and dietary awareness**: The answer mentions receiving a report based on the test results to increase health and dietary awareness. Passage 4 supports this by stating that the test results will show whether the diet is balanced or unbalanced and provide recommendations.

Given the analysis, the claims made in the answer are directly supported by the passages, particularly Passage 4, with additional support from Passage 3 and others regarding the importance of omega-3 levels and the omega-6 to omega-3 ratio.
